author: arcamax.com
title: Ask Stacy for Oct. 10-11, 2015 | The Hollywood Exclusive | Columns
text:
DEAR STACY: What were they thinking, getting rid of Dean Cain on "Worst Cooks in America: Celebrity Edition"? My favorite Superman is the only reason I tuned in, and I'm sure I am not alone! What is he going to do now? -- Sharon W., Atlanta, Ga.
DEAR SHARON: Don't take it so hard. The affable actor seems to be taking his departure from the Food Network show in stride, even though he was the first celebrity to be eliminated. He's chatted about how much he admires chefs Rachael Ray and Anne Burrell. "It's like you're going to learn to play football from Joe Montana. Their level of knowledge is so high," he said. And he appreciates the $5,000 contribution in his name to the Gary Sinise Foundation. And Cain is never one to sit still long. He's gone on to the feature film "Gosnell," about Philadelphia abortion doctor Kermit Gosnell, in which he is playing Detective James Wood.
----
DEAR STACY: Whose voice is in the 2016 Mazda MX-5 Miata commercial? It's driving me crazy. -- Manny S., Oceanside, Calif.
DEAR MANNY: That's "Breaking Bad" star Aaron Paul in the snazzy spot featuring a driver going through life's milestones.
----
DEAR STACY: I was disappointed to find out that "Revenge" isn't coming back. What is next for Emily VanCamp? -- FisoWi
DEAR FisoWi: Expect to see VanCamp's Peggy Carter, aka Agent 13, have a pretty high-profile role in "Captain America: Civil War," which is due for release next May. She and boyfriend and former "Revenge" cast mate Josh Bowman were recently photographed vacationing in Sardinia between camera calls.
----
DEAR STACY: Is it true that Angelina Jolie is bisexual? -- Isaiah C., Port Washington, N.Y.
DEAR ISAIAH: It is true that the actress also known as Mrs. Brad Pitt has declared herself so. She was Quote: d in OK! Magazine saying, "I have loved women in the past and slept with them."
